intro: Wahlenbergia cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical flower stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Wahlenbergia cylindrica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
